text: Dysart railway station served the burgh of Dysart, Fife, Scotland from 1847 to 1969 on the Edinburgh and Northern Railway. == History == The station opened on 20 September 1847 by the Edinburgh and Northern Railway. The goods yard was to the east and the signal box was to the northwest, opposite sidings which served Frances Colliery. The station closed on 6 October 1969 and the signal box in 1980. == References == == External links == Category:Disused railway stations in Fife Category:Former North British Railway stations Category:Railway stations in Great Britain opened in 1847 Category:Railway stations in Great Britain closed in 1969 Category:1847 establishments in Scotland Category:1969 disestablishments in Scotland
title: Dysart railway station, Fife
